dc:title: Spring Appeal - April 1963
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Writing on the feast of St. Joseph, she focuses her appeal around Peter Maurin's call for a philosophy of work and gives examples of "faint beginnings" that illustrate his ideas.
dc:identifier: Dorothy Day Library on the Web document 802 1963-04-02 James Allaire Creative Commons Non-Commercial Share Alike 3.0 en-US http://www.catholicworker.org/dorothyday
